Riemann Sums Program Documentation

2.0

This is a program which computes the Riemann sums and trapeziod rule sums of an expression over a given interval with a given number of steps. It is used for the estimation of the area under a curve, or the integral. For information on Riemann sums, see http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Riemann_sum . The entry point is _main() in ram.c. Various functions dealing with popping or examining elements on the expression stack are located in jstack.c. For a reentrant (besides temporarily enlarging the stack) function to call which does riemann sums or trapeziod rule calculations, see riemann_sum() or trap_rule() in ram.c.

Arguments

Note: The arguments are taken from the expression stack on the calculator.

expression

The expression to be integrated.

var

The variable of integration.

lower bounds

The lower boundary of the interval.

upper bounds

The upper boundary of the interval.

number of steps

The number of sections to divide the region into; the number of sampling points. Increasing this will increase the accuracy, but will make the program take longer to execute.

function index

This determines which computation will be performed according to the following:
0 = left riemann sum
1 = middle riemann sum
2 = right riemann sum
3 = trapezoid rule
